data.text: There are certain moments when Matthews touches the puck in the offensive zone when you can confidently say "yeah, he'll score" when he winds up for the shot. That 1-0 goal was certainly one of them.
@derekw306 Is that the case? I've found other games later than 24 hours after the fact.
@risingaction It's shocking. The league should really step in. No way this fills the void left by NHL Live.

Anybody with Sportsnet Now premium, can you check to see if any of the nationally-televised games from Wednesday night are available for you? I couldn't load the Canucks-Sharks game to track it last night.

@TheLaxedd On the Natural Stat Trick game pages, if you go to the individual event maps, you can hover over each individual event and get all the available details

https://t.co/gPwVg405zR

Also, I strongly encourage everybody to avoid any sort of prop bet that is based on the judgment from the un-audited scorekeepers. Goals and assists are checked and re-checked and corrected. Shots, blocks, hits, takeaways... aren't. There are a dozen mistakes a game.

Hilariously, Michael Bunting had a rebound follow-up after the Tavares shot. Instead of being tagged as a rebound shot, it counted as a "rush" shot on NST because the Dallas scorekeeper tagged the previous play seconds earlier about 150 feet away from where it actually took place

The xG of the shot, based on what we have from the NHL, is not only 0 (because it's a blocked shot), but it's also -1 corsi for the Leafs, since the play was incorrectly marked as a Tavares block of a Heiskanen shot.
To close the loop on this one, it looks like my followers have, on average, pegged the xG of this shot at about 13.7%, which seems a LITTLE high but probably within the actual range.

@JFreshHockey I think there's a tendency among scorekeepers to credit shots that go in as being closer than those that are saved. Witness where Caufield's goal against Vancouver was recorded from versus where the shot was actually taken.
@Account4hockey Well, yes

@Esch87 @mirtle The linesman is very clearly watching the puck though, plus Forbort isn't all that fast. Maybe it's because Forbort pulled up a little at the end, but either way I'd like for a journalist to be able to ask what the linesman was looking for when he waved it off.

@sprotsplease I cracked the code a few years ago. If the linesman is yelling at the player to "get the line" and he doesn't cross the red line, it's icing. If the linesman doesn't, he gets a few feet of grace.
@mirtle Just read the entire text of the rule and nothing about the crease is mentioned.
If you can challenge offside, you should be allowed to challenge icing. https://t.co/03pnI1Omm7
Now would be a good time for @TSN_Sports to turn off promoted tweets for the World Cup.
RT @KerithBurke: Hoping for more information, but for now, this is Grant Wahl. https://t.co/d5P5Ng9Lo8
RT @NeedlesOnNews: The man who wrote this just mysteriously died in Qatar.

@sprotsplease @JasonVDE @patersonjeff Maybe. I think he has slowed down a fair bit (he's frequently caught in situations where I'm not used to him being caught) and he's not working with teammates that understand how to take advantage of it.

I get that he's producing, but he doesn't seem like the same player, to me.
@JasonVDE @patersonjeff I'm not sure. In Toronto, a lot of his breakaways were created off loose pucks or pucks thrown to open space. It happened with regularity.

@garik16 I think after the 32 games from non-Conference teams and 45 games from Conference teams, the remaining 5 games should be distributed based on classic or playoff rivalries. Maybe toss in an extra home-and-home for an opposite conference team.
@garik16 It was the case last season too. 2 games against teams in the other conference, 3 games against conference opponents, and an extra game against 5 divisional teams.

urls.title: How Matt Murray and Ilya Samsonov are benefitting from a strong Maple Leafs defence
urls.description: Murray and Samsonov look good right now, and Leafs defenders are doing a good job of limiting scoring chances and shots against.

data.text:
But, Cam, how does this affect the Leafs? 

Well, I hypothesize that some of the better defensive teams in the NHL are quite good at cutting down on the time opposing teams have before shooting, which makes life easy for the goalies.

https://t.co/kktakF0iK4

What a fantastic shot (and great jerseys as well). It's clear that even from tough angles, you can't give elite players in this league any time and space. So many players can pick corners like this. https://t.co/bVBR4ynhrc
@patersonjeff I wonder if Sasha Mikheyev looks a lot slower than he did last season, too.
Also, I was tallying up some of my tracked numbers and Engvall has been really good. Post up this weekend or early next week detailing why I think so.

This is fair. Anything more than Kuznetsov's slash on Burroughs earlier this season (which was much more vicious and somehow only drew two minutes plus one game https://t.co/pOI68iKsvB) would have been out of line. https://t.co/rWWifXaJy6

@bruce_arthur That some of the movie took place in a parallel universe where Michelle Yeoh's character was actually Michelle Yeoh was brilliant. I don't think I'll ever experience a movie like that ever again. I walked into the theatre knowing nothing about it.

On the gamefinder page (credit where it's due, it's a welcome addition and makes finding games a lot easier), they have one link to the English broadcast and one for the French and don't tell you which is which. https://t.co/gnUnEN1sUu
I've never been a fan of the defensive player lying down behind the wall on free kicks and I hope that the trend dies a swift death following that tying goal.
@VinceRusso5 Working for me. What are you using?

urls.title: How Matt Murray and Ilya Samsonov are benefitting from a strong Maple Leafs defence
urls.description: Murray and Samsonov look good right now, and Leafs defenders are doing a good job of limiting scoring chances and shots against.

data.text:
Murray and Samsonov are playing well, but I think the Leafs defence creates a much easier environment for goalies to thrive than people may think.

https://t.co/kiXayKHXs9

On one hand, Sh% regresses. On the other hand, external inputs matter. Matthews' shots over the last couple of weeks have been much more dangerous and plentiful than the two weeks or so leading up to that post.

urls.title: Where has Auston Matthews' goal scoring gone?
urls.description: Cam Charron looks at the Maple Leafs' first 23 games to help explain Matthews' slow start.

data.text:
Nice to see Auston get chances in tight. This wasn't a thing that was happening when he was struggling to score at 5v5

https://t.co/hKUY7vi5gm https://t.co/eAPVyCmyBX
Will DoPS announce a hearing for Engvall tomorrow morning, or minutes after the final whistle? https://t.co/hyTwuyrscp
@hayyyshayyy #ButtSauce

I feel like if your man falls over behind the net, you shouldn't allow him to get a perfect pass off to the high slot.

The Kings didn't go down 4-0 on this play but did seconds later. https://t.co/ejrOP4tRnY
@DBlye @DownGoesBrown I live with a Warriors fan, so certain basketball series in the late teens are off-limits as conversation topics.

@DownGoesBrown It's really incredible how that series is still going on, 12 years later. Has there been any other championship game or series in any other sport that provided so much drama in the ensuing years?
@Leafs_25 I think what made the goaltending performance so devastating last season was that it happened behind good defence.

Still, the Bruins formula has worked pretty well. Have a few players that dominate, and break even when they're off the ice. As long as that GF% in the second chart stays above 50%, the Bruins are in great shape.
Looking at @shawnferris98 tracked Bruins data, no players that aren't usual suspects are really having a dominant season in transition, except maybe Coyle.
I put more stock in GF% than SCF% when it comes to elite players but less so when it's the non-elite guys. Hampus Lindholm is a great back who elevates his team's offence, but he isn't that good.
The Bruins leader in points rate isn't Pastrnak, or Marchand. It's Trent Frederic. Guys like him, Coyle, Zacha, even Foligno are having career seasons.
Now, look at the Bruins when all of the big three is off the ice. Not a huge change in SCF%, but that GF% is way up: https://t.co/MZY2bcBxwn

One thing to note is that the Bruins don't seem to suffer at all when the line is split. Any combination of those three players over the last five seasons has been good regardless. Either way, they're still trucking along, having a great season.

Talked about the Bruins a bit on @DailyFaceoff and wanted to show you guys something interesting. Here's the Bruins in terms of SCF% and GF% (per @NatStatTrick) when at least one of the big three is on the ice: https://t.co/VYcvrWalH0

He also leads the team in turnovers forced in the opponent's defensive zone.

Intelligence is a trait that doesn't fade with age, and I think Tavares is learning to use his strength and frame, rather than speed, to create space for himself and his linemates.

The comments on Tavares' transition game are important. He's 2nd on the Leafs in both controlled exit and controlled entry percentage, by my tracking. I don't have last year's numbers but I'm quite confident he was not that. https://t.co/lPhicrFbsY
@ldl716 @nylanderthews I don't think they do. I think they need the right mix of players since they had this working a few weeks ago. I'm perplexed by Malgin's absence.
@BallinChint @Sportsnet For a few minutes until one of the feed freezes, and provided I use Google Chrome and Chrome is up to date, sure.
@Spence_Smith24 @Sportsnet I would like you to get started. Nothing will change.
@Sportsnet Flipping back and forth between games on my iPad and I have to restart the app each time.
@LouisTheFrank @Sportsnet I get that on DAZN so it isn't a Sportsnet exclusive.

By far my favourite feature of @Sportsnet Now is how the game will just go to commercial and then... not come back, and you sit in your office in silence for a few minutes before cluing into the fact that it isn't coming back unless you restart the app.
RT @CMhockey66: Fitting they are both in Buffalo because the Tage Thompson explosion reminds me of Josh Allen in that I think teams who try…
This is goals, by the way, not points. Hockey Twitter can't suddenly begin to care about the second assist when records are on the line.
FYI, the last time anybody's scored 6 in a game was Darryl Sittler in 1976, the night he got 10 points.

I took over a keeper team in a league with my Dad and all of his buddies. Auction league, $30 budget for 30 players.

Didn't have great keeper options, but decided to keep Tage for $1 and Horvat for the 10-cent minimum. Sometimes dumb people like myself get lucky.
@travisyost Wow, looks like you could clean and j--

urls.title: Toronto Maple Leafs 4 at Dallas Stars 0 – 2022-12-06 recap

data.text:
The microstatistics are subscriber-only, but I did post a little bit about last night's Leafs-Stars game, pouring a bit of cold water on the idea that Matt Murray stole the game for the Leafs. He was good, but I doubt he was the team's best player.

https://t.co/iAlOdm4UWE

I'm all caught up on Leafs game tracking. I've just posted the last three games to https://t.co/GEiswx6ba5

Missing Canucks posts will be up tomorrow and from then on, the December schedule is pretty light and game posts should be shortly after game end.
There's somebody that works these broadcasts whose sole goal is to make me throw in the towel and stop watching hockey altogether. https://t.co/avWtjCIvWP

Tired: "Hey, what's the score?"

Wired: "How many defenceman have the Leafs used this season?"

Again, who is asking for this stuff? https://t.co/D93BrbduqQ

Kind of ridiculous that it looks like Tkachuk is going to escape this play with the same penalty he'd get for batting the puck over the glass in the defensive zone. A player who was suspended earlier this season for a stick infraction with textbook spearing.

Fire Parros. https://t.co/Yk0wqibZkk

@jtbourne Just got to that goal right now in my tracking.

It's kind of similar to the Tavares goal against Philly earlier in the year. At what point should the D "help" and collapse to the scoring area like they do in basketball?

I made an executive decision that may also save a few bytes of memory. https://t.co/WckTNSimSh
@CoryMcQuhae @TheStanchion That might require the beancounters working for the rightsholder to give the smallest amount of shits about the sport or their audience.

Ten seconds of action is missed. I'm always interested in how teams create controlled exits off DZ faceoff wins. Instead, we get slow motion replays of Luke Schenn hits. I blame @TheStanchion for this, personally. https://t.co/4sqQTmyHSe

If you're going to cover up the scorebug to post the lineups, try to show all the D. (I don't think Arizona ran 11/5 this game, despite some JJ Moser and Josh Brown erasure by some producer) https://t.co/WOlRYvK246

@LeafsPlusMinus MLB makes umpires available to reporters after controversial calls. NBA releases a report detailing all decisions made in the final two minutes.

It would be great if Marc Joanette and Michael Markovic had to face reporters after the game and answer why they called this slashing, but the NHL isn't a real league and protects its referees more than its players.

Here's the Tkachuk play in question. Rule 62.1 states that "spearing... stabbing an opponent with the point of the stick blade, whether contact is made or not".

A spearing where contact is made is at least 5 minutes. Obvious blown call by the officials in Winnipeg. https://t.co/5TqkoZuoDN
Seeing that Matthew Tkachuk speared another player. Surprising, given that DOPS threw the book at him after this play. https://t.co/NJUKhyvbOu
@GarretHohl The models still overrate Austin Czarnik, eh?

data.text:
I'm trying to think of what caused the sudden onslaught of offensive players in hockey. It may be due to the fact that the onslaught began about 10 years after this goal which was played on a loop for weeks.

https://t.co/xjBgHo93nZ https://t.co/wWBFSv9C1s
https://t.co/wSTNbqsOpG
How would you best describe what happened in the following tweet?
@garik16 Devising ways to research this.

Like with the save/goal binary, I agree with faceoff win/loss. A faceoff win means nothing if your team doesn't get the puck and then clear/enter/shoot based on where the faceoff was won. Always the benefit of your top guys being good FO players, rather than, like, Jay Beagle. https://t.co/h5oRbt1tKD

Not necessarily. The one I clipped is a neutral zone faceoff during a lull in a tie game. A puck is never more than a few seconds away from potentially being in either net and the game can turn on a dime or one possession.

Looking at "timely" wins just lowers the sample size. https://t.co/wUJTQN40EQ

I've always been skeptical of the value of faceoffs, but the fact that John Tavares consistently wins >60% of them probably counts for something. SJS didn't touch the puck in the neutral zone for 21 seconds following this unorthodox win. https://t.co/Efi7Y53snR
@AavcoCup I think so too. It doesn't affect watching live play.
@BlakeMurphyODC "Players can't go through the boards. They're not fire."

Fantastic thread, and this could be a reason it takes me a lot longer to track games this season and why I feel sick all the time. They've turned hockey into an active activity cognitively instead of a relaxing one. https://t.co/5AgxQIkpZr
And yet I can't wait to track this one. My spreadsheet might explode. https://t.co/4qhBngYusi
Instead of putting an extra guy at the point, the Canucks use both Kuzmenko and Boeser net-front and get the tie. That's inspired stuff. https://t.co/8Wtw6ghpfr
The Canucks are a good enough 5v4 team that I might just keep Delia in the net here.
@taj1944 Only one team in league history has ever finished 32nd. #Olé
@passittobulis I've been out of town. What happened?

@camcharronyvr Faceoffs are genuinely important but the binary  measurements are misleading.  Results ->  clear wins, clear losses, ties, scrums etc.  5 seconds left in the game, a clear win with the puck ->point -> One timer scoring chance is super valuable. Situation + real results matter.

@camcharronyvr I would rather have European style jersey ads than this crappy board ad BS

The @NHL digital board ads have made hockey *physically* more difficult to watch on TV this season. Putting aside any philosophical concerns about commercialization, there are a number of *technical* reasons why it hurts your eyes to watch this. A THREAD … (1/n) https://t.co/eaZZ0Mf1Th
No matter how this finishes, there's no point analysing this game. This is what happens when 2 bad teams face each other.
The Canucks are a good enough 5v4 team that I might just keep Delia in the net here.
Lesson here is never assume a game is over when a bottom 5 team is up big. There's a reason why they're at the bottom of the standings.
@camcharronyvr What about eight years?
